title: Motivated Forgetting: The Brain's Self-Defense
description: A quick win: understand Motivated Forgetting: The Brain's Self-Defense.

hook.text: Freud called it 'repression.' Modern science calls it 'motivated forgetting.' It's real.

buildup.text: The brain can actively suppress memories that cause distress or psychological pain.

discovery.text: The 'think/no-think' paradigm shows people can deliberately weaken unwanted memories.

twist.text: The prefrontal cortex inhibits the hippocampusâ€”it's a top-down shutdown of retrieval.

climax.text: This mechanism protects us, but can also cause gaps in trauma survivors' memories.

punchline.text: Sometimes forgetting is the brain protecting itself.

quiz.question: How does motivated forgetting work neurologically?
options: The prefrontal cortex inhibits the hippocampus to suppress retrieval
Unwanted memories are physically deleted from the brain
Stress hormones dissolve memory traces automatically
